title: Robert Ethelbert Beattie
text: Robert Ethelbert Beattie (March 20, 1875 – May 5, 1925) was a <a href="Canadian">Canadian</a> <a href="politician">politician</a> and <a href="pharmacist">pharmacist</a>. He was elected to the <a href="House%20of%20Commons%20of%20Canada">House of Commons of Canada</a> as a Member of the <a href="Liberal%20Party%20of%20Canada">Liberal Party</a> in the <a href="1921%20Canadian%20federal%20election">1921</a> election to represent the <a href="Electoral%20district%20%28Canada%29">riding</a> of <a href="Kootenay%20East">Kootenay East</a> and on February 9, 1922, he accepted an office of <a href="Remuneration">emolument</a> under <a href="monarchy%20of%20Canada">the Crown</a>. He was defeated in the 1917 election as a <a href="Laurier%20Liberal">Laurier Liberal</a>.
